meanings.definition: To cut back or prune (a plant) to promote new growth.
meanings.sent1: I ratooned the bushes in the garden to help them grow better.
meanings.sent2: The gardener ratooned the trees to encourage fresh branches to sprout.
meanings.sent3: The plants looked surprised after being ratooned, as if they had just gotten a haircut.
meanings.sent4: She ratooned the rosebushes with precision, like a sculptor shaping a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The act of ratooning made the garden burst with life, like a magical transformation.
